ygData.subject: Re: Plate/Weapons
ygData.msgSnippet: Patrick, not a problem... hehe... I am doing smithing to make My OWN armor... Yes I also make some for others and sell it, but I have yet to become *rich* at
ygData.messageBody:
Patrick, not a problem... hehe... I am doing smithing to make My OWN
armor... Yes I also make some for others and sell it, but I have yet to
become *rich* at it... In fact, I only have about 25 plat in the bank now...
hehe... And I will need at least 60 plat to buy the Cleric 19th level spells
(I am 18.5 now)... I also learned fishing for the same reason... to feed
myself... Now I have spells that make food and water, so I rarely practice
it. The same will probably happen with smithing once I get all the armor I
need... But it is still a BUSINESS as well... a different way to make
money... I even have a dwarf friend that travels back and forth to buy molds
(small size) for me every once in a while... and HE makes a profit too! No
biggy...

As to carpal tunnel and other such 'typing & mousing' related illnesses, I
don't have a problem with them... I have been working with computers and
typing since 1978 and don't have problems at all! I do proper stretching
exercises and use proper posture, in addition, a gel filled wrist rest for
both keyboard and mouse (which I HIGHLY recommend - from FELLOWES Co.) keep
the pressure off also... So, no worries... hehe...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server

> From: patrick.r.baxter@...
>
> Just remember friend... Money can't by happiness ;) Rent it maybe...
>
> Just becareful not to get corpal tunnel or tenditis in you wrists and arms
> from those hours spent smithing, surgery is a bitch.
>
> From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
>
> > From: patrick.r.baxter@...
> >
> > Money is such a small part of this game it is pathetic. The only thing
> you
> > need money for is buy spells and some raw materials. Most things that
can
> > be made with trade skills (particularly blacksmithing) can be found in
the
> > game world on monsters and are way better.
> >
> > I have done smithing, and I would much rather spend my time out in the
> world
> > of norrath fighting evil and gaining off of that, then sitting at the
> local
> > forge trying to make an extremely boring fortune.
>
> Patrick, I am so glad to hear you say that! One less blacksmith to
compete
> with! And your right, you can find banded armor all over the place, so
why
> buy it? Oh, I mean you can find RING armor that is way better... yeah,
> that;s what I meant... I think...
>
> Well, in any case, have fun out fighting evil, and don't worry, the rest
of
> us will take care of all that boring smithing stuff... because after all,
we
> are all just greedy blacksmiths who want to have millions of plat!
>
>
> Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server
>
>
>
